body:
If your WM does not support this by default, Alacritty currently does not have any way to bind a minimize key without invoking an external command.

Though this should be trivial to add, if someone is interested in contributing.
@chrisduerr I might take a stab at it. Can you point me to the direction?

Of course!

First of all, the required winit APIs to modify Window minimized state should be these:
https://docs.rs/winit/0.19.1/winit/struct.Window.html#method.show
https://docs.rs/winit/0.19.1/winit/struct.Window.html#method.hide

These probably need to be exposed on the `alacritty_terminar/src/window.rs` first. I think a `hide` method already exists, not sure about showing.

Then to hook it all up, the config.yml documentation and the input handling need to be modified. A good reference would be the existing `ToggleFullscreen` and `ToggleSimpleFullscreen` bindings. Searching this repo should find all instances of them and just copying what they do should be fine.

To go into a bit more detail, you'd need to define an action [like this](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty_terminal/src/input.rs#L258) and then bind that action to modify the window [like this](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty_terminal/src/input.rs#L304-L306).

That should basically be it, let me know if you need any more info and I can get into a bit more detail. There usually are people in #alacritty on the freenode IRC too if you need more real-time feedback.

Ah okay, I had to read up on this myself, but it seems like hiding the window will make it invisible without adding it to the dock, while minimizing a window will make it invisible and add it to the dock.

Sounds like it does indeed need a macOS specific patch then.

issue.title: MacOS minimize support

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2534.

Currently winit exposes an API on all platforms to set the window visibility using the `set_visible` method. If this is called on macOS, the window is hidden without adding it to the dock, this is working as intended.

However, on macOS a different method of hiding windows exists too, this is called `miniaturize` [in their docs](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nswindow/1419426-miniaturize?language=objc)  which makes the window invisible and adds it to the dock. I believe this is what happens when the minimize button is clicked in the window decorations, but as far as I can tell there's no way to call this explicitly from winit.

The generated cocoa-rs bindings provide [this method](https://github.com/servo/cocoa-rs/blob/ea0667fdd2cffbdc442e50bbf6a2977ba7c2d322/src/appkit.rs#L1018) on `NsWindow`. So I think it should be relatively trivial to implement this using the [`WindowsExtMacOS`](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/blob/master/src/platform/macos.rs#L12), since I don't think it's available in this fashion on any other platform.

Alternatively, this could be declared as out of scope, so downstream consumers would have to use the [`ns_window`](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/blob/master/src/platform/macos.rs#L16) call instead to do this themselves.

body:
I've created an issue upstream: https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/983

Looking into this, it might be a good first issue for anyone interested in contributing to winit, assuming that the feature is accepted. I don't think this should be too complicated to implement.
I appreciate you looking into this @chrisduerr. Haven't had the time to give this a shot just yet but it is on my list.
What's the state of this issue? I just moved from iTerm2 and quite need that functionality

@kkoscielniak You can use github notification feature and subscribe to this PR https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/990 to be always informed about the status of this issue. As soon as it gets merged will add this feature to alacritty.
@kchibisov I use GitHub for around 10 years and never thought of it. Thanks!
@davidhewitt Is there a standard hotkey on Windows 10 to minimize a window? If "yes", is it working with alacritty right now?
